apis.Name: Get all API details in Madhyama
apis.Description: Returns details of all the APIs present in Madhyama

allRoute.Name: Get All Data
allRoute.Description: Returns all data in the system. Warning: this request returns 8MB+ and takes 5+ seconds

countriesRoute.Name: Get List Of Countries
countriesRoute.Description: Returns all countries and associated provinces. The country_slug variable is used for country specific data

countryDayOneRoute.Name: Get List Of Cases Per Country Per Province By Case Type From The First Recorded Case
countryDayOneRoute.Description: Returns all cases by case type for a country from the first recorded case. Country must be the country_slug from /countries. Cases must be one of: confirmed, recovered, deaths

countryDayOneTotalRoute.Name: Get List Of Cases Per Country By Case Type From The First Recorded Case
countryDayOneTotalRoute.Description: Returns all cases by case type for a country from the first recorded case. Country must be the country_slug from /countries. Cases must be one of: confirmed, recovered, deaths

countryRoute.Name: Get List Of Cases Per Country Per Province By Case Type
countryRoute.Description: Returns all cases by case type for a country. Country must be the country_slug from /countries. Cases must be one of: confirmed, recovered, deaths

countryStatusDayOneLiveRoute.Name: Get List Of Cases Per Country Per Province By Case Type From The First Recorded Case, updated with latest live count
countryStatusDayOneLiveRoute.Description: Returns all cases by case type for a country from the first recorded case with the latest record being the live count. Country must be the country_slug from /countries. Cases must be one of: confirmed, recovered, deaths

countryStatusDayOneRoute.Name: Get List Of Cases Per Country Per Province By Case Type From The First Recorded Case
countryStatusDayOneRoute.Description: Returns all cases by case type for a country from the first recorded case. Country must be the country_slug from /countries. Cases must be one of: confirmed, recovered, deaths

countryStatusDayOneTotalRoute.Name: Get List Of Cases Per Country By Case Type From The First Recorded Case
countryStatusDayOneTotalRoute.Description: Returns all cases by case type for a country from the first recorded case. Country must be the country_slug from /countries. Cases must be one of: confirmed, recovered, deaths

countryStatusLiveRoute.Name: Daily list of cases per Country per Province by Case Type, updated with latest live count
countryStatusLiveRoute.Description: Returns all cases by case type for a country with the latest record being the live count. Country must be the country_slug from /countries. Cases must be one of: confirmed, recovered, deaths

countryStatusRoute.Name: Get List Of Cases Per Country Per Province By Case Type
countryStatusRoute.Description: Returns all cases by case type for a country. Country must be the country_slug from /countries. Cases must be one of: confirmed, recovered, deaths

countryStatusTotalRoute.Name: Get List Of Cases Per Country By Case Type
countryStatusTotalRoute.Description: Returns all cases by case type for a country. Country must be the country_slug from /countries. Cases must be one of: confirmed, recovered, deaths

countryTotalRoute.Name: Get List Of Cases Per Country By Case Type
countryTotalRoute.Description: Returns all cases by case type for a country. Country must be the country_slug from /countries. Cases must be one of: confirmed, recovered, deaths

liveCountryRoute.Name: Get Live List Of Cases Per Country Per Province By Case Type
liveCountryRoute.Description: Returns all live cases by case type for a country. These records are pulled every 10 minutes and are ungrouped. Country must be the country_slug from /countries. Cases must be one of: confirmed, recovered, deaths

liveCountryStatusAfterDateRoute.Name: Get a Time Series Of Cases Per Country Per Province By Case Type After A Date
liveCountryStatusAfterDateRoute.Description: Returns all live cases by case type for a country after a given date. These records are pulled every 10 minutes and are ungrouped. Country must be the country_slug from /countries. Cases must be one of: confirmed, recovered, deaths

liveCountryStatusRoute.Name: Get a time series Of Cases Per Country Per Province By Case Type
liveCountryStatusRoute.Description: Returns all live cases by case type for a country. These records are pulled every 10 minutes and are ungrouped. Country must be the country_slug from /countries. Cases must be one of: confirmed, recovered, deaths
liveCountryStatusRoute.Example: http: / /localhost: 8080 / madhyama / covid19 / live / country / india / status / confirmed

summaryRoute.Name: Summary of new and total cases per country
summaryRoute.Description: A summary of new and total cases per country

webhookRoute.Name: Add a webhook to be notified when new data becomes available
webhookRoute.Description: POST Request must be in JSON format with key URL and the value of the webhook. Response data is the same as returned from /summary

worldWIPRoute.Name: Get World WIP
worldWIPRoute.Description: Returns all live cases by case type for a country after a given date. These records are pulled every 10 minutes and are ungrouped. Country must be the slug from /countries or /summary. Cases must be one of: confirmed, recovered, deaths

worldWIPTotalRoute.Name: Get total World WIP
worldWIPTotalRoute.Description: Returns all live cases by case type for a country after a given date. These records are pulled every 10 minutes and are ungrouped. Country must be the slug from /countries or /summary. Cases must be one of: confirmed, recovered, deaths

statisticsRoute.Name: Get Complete Statistics
statisticsRoute.Description: This route returns the usage of the API. This is not for any COVID related statistics.

ghoDimenstionsList.Name: Retrieving the list of available dimensions
ghoDimenstionsList.Description: Simply specifying the madhyama/gho/api/ URL will provide you with the list of available dimension codes.

ghoDimenstionCodesList.Name: Retrieving a list of available codes for a specific dimension
ghoDimenstionCodesList.Description: By appending a dimension code to the Athena data URL, you can retrieve the list of codes associated with that specific dimension. For example to retrieve the list of indicator codes, stored in the dimension GHO.

ghoRegionCodesList.Name: Retrieving GHO Region codes
ghoRegionCodesList.Description: Simply specifying the madhyama/gho/api/REGION URL will provide you with the list of available regions codes.

ghoData.Name: Retrieving data
ghoData.Description: Specify a target to download by specifying both a dimension and a code within that dimension. This will return all associated data for the target in the Observatory's JSON format. Building on the previous example, take the code WHOSIS_000001, Life expectancy at birth and retrieve the data for this indicator.

ghoFilteringData.Name: Filtering data
ghoFilteringData.Description: You can filter the data returned by the web service by identifying specific dimensions and dimension codes that you wish to include or exclude. Use the URL parameter filter with a list of fully qualified dimension codes separated by semicolons. A fully qualified dimension code consists of the dimension label, a colon, and the code for a member of that dimension. For example, the fully qualified code for the country of Botswana is COUNTRY:BWA. Continuing to build on the query from the previous example, if you wish to see the life expectancy at birth data for Botswana and life expectancy in Botswana for both combined sexes for the year 2011.

ghoMultipleTargets.Name: Retrieving multiple targets
ghoMultipleTargets.Description: You can retrieve multiple target codes from a single query, as long as those target codes come from the same dimension, such as GHO Measure (GHO). Simply append the additional codes to the first target, separating them with commas (','). For example, we can retrieve both life expectancy at birth, WHOSIS_000001, and life expectancy at 60, WHOSIS_000015.

ghoOnlyCountryOrRegionData.Name: Retrieving only country or regional data
ghoOnlyCountryOrRegionData.Description: You can retrieve only country data and exclude regional data using the filter parameter. In addition to specifying specific fully qualified dimension member codes, you can also specify two special cases: You can specify that a dimension must be set for a fact to be returned for a query by using an asterisk, '*', for example, filter=COUNTRY:* requires that any returned fact must have a country dimension. You can specify that a dimension must not be set for a fact to be returned for a query by using a hyphen, '-', for example, filter=COUNTRY:- requires that any returned fact must not have a country dimension. If we wish to retrieve only country data for our previous example query, use COUNTRY. And if we wish to retrieve only regional data for the same indicator, use COUNTRY:-;REGION:*.

ghoCountryInSpecificRegionData.Name: Retrieving data for countries in a specific region
ghoCountryInSpecificRegionData.Description: You can then use one or more of these codes to restrict query results to countries belonging to the specified region(s). For example, if we to retrieve the life expectancy data for countries in Europe, we use the region code REGION:EUR and also specify COUNTRY:* because we are only interested in the country data itself and not the regional aggregate.

ghoUsingDimemsionMemberAttributesData.Name: Retrieving data using dimension member attributes
ghoUsingDimemsionMemberAttributesData.Description: Filters can be specified to select dimension member codes based on their attribute values, using by specifying a filter of the form: &filter=DIMENSIONCODE:*,ATTR1=VALUE1[,ATTR2=VALUE2]. For example, if you wish to retrieve data, say for life expectancy, for all countries whose ISO code starts with an A. You must specify attribute codes that are recognized for the dimension you with to use. Several attributes can be specified by seperating them with a comma character. Multiple attributes will be ANDed together in order to derive the final list of dimension member codes for the specified dimension.

countryData.Name: Requesting all countries data
countryData.Description: The following information will appear, when available, in the response when using this country query through the World Bank API: 1. 3 letter ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 code. 2. 2 letter ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code. 3. Name. 4. Region: ID, name and World Bank 2 letter code. 5. Income Level: ID, name and World Bank 2 letter code 6. Lending Type: ID, name and World Bank 2 letter code. 7. Capital City. 8. Longitude. 9. Latitude.

specificCountriesData.Name: Requesting specific countries data using countrycode
specificCountriesData.Description: The following information will appear, when available, in the response when using this country query through the World Bank API: 1. 3 letter ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 code. 2. 2 letter ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code. 3. Name. 4. Region: ID, name and World Bank 2 letter code. 5. Income Level: ID, name and World Bank 2 letter code 6. Lending Type: ID, name and World Bank 2 letter code. 7. Capital City. 8. Longitude. 9. Latitude. Note: The API returns ISO 3 and ISO 2 codes wherever present. If ISO codes are not available, it returns WB 3 and WB 2 codes. For example, Channel Islands return WB 3 code CHI and WB2 code JG. You can apply a filter to see all countries in a specified aggregate. To list specific countries data, separating multiple codes with semicolons (;)

sourceData.Name: Requesting all source data
sourceData.Description: You get complete source data list.

specificSourcesData.Name: Requesting specific sources data
specificSourcesData.Description: You get source data of the specified source id.

indicatorCode.Name: Requesting all indicator codes
indicatorCode.Description: Requesting indicator codes. Indicators represent data like total population, gross national income, energy use, and many more. Indicator queries return the following information in the response: Code, Name, Unit, Source ID, Source Note, Source Organization, Topic ID, Topic Name.

specificIndicatorCode.Name: Requesting specific indicators code data
specificIndicatorCode.Example: To request the indicator GDP (Current US$), use its indicator code, NY.GDP.MKTP.CD: http://localhost:8080/madhyama/worldbank/indicator/NY.GDP.MKTP.CD

indicatorData.Name: Requesting indicator data
indicatorData.Description: Aggregates—by region, income level or lending group—are also available in the API. You can retrieve data for aggregates by using the appropriate code where you would otherwise specify a country.
indicatorData.Example: The following two examples retrieve GDP data for Brazil (BRA) and the Latin America: http://localhost:8080/madhyama/worldbank/country/BRA/indicator/NY.GDP.MKTP.CD

indicatorDataUsingSourceId.Name: Requesting indicator data using Source Id
indicatorDataUsingSourceId.Description: Sometimes indicators belong to multiple sources. To find an indicator from a specific source, the indicator’s source ID must be provided as a query parameter.

regionCode.Name: Requesting regions codes
regionCode.Description: To get the definition list for all Region codes.

specificRegionsCode.Name: Requesting specific regions code
specificRegionsCode.Description: To get the definition list for one Region code.

levelCode.Name: Requesting all income level codes
levelCode.Description: To get the list of all Income Level code definitions.

specificLevelsCode.Name: Requesting specific income levels code
specificLevelsCode.Description: To get the single Income Level code definitions.

lendingTypeCode.Name: Requesting all lending type codes
lendingTypeCode.Description: To get the list of all Lending Type code definitions.

specificLendingTypesCode.Name: Requesting specific lending types code
specificLendingTypesCode.Description: To get the single Lending Type code definitions.

topics.Name: Requesting topics data
topics.Description: Topics are high level categories to which all indicators are mapped. Agriculture & Rural Development, Education, and Trade are examples of topics.

specificTopicsData.Name: Requesting specific topics data using topicids
specificTopicsData.Description: To list specific topics, separating multiple codes with semicolons (;)

indicatorsUnderSpecificTopics.Name: Requesting all indicators in specified topic
indicatorsUnderSpecificTopics.Description: To list all indicators under a specified topic

concept.Name: Concept Queries
concept.Description: This call will return the following information, when available, about concepts of a specific source. Source ID, Concept ID and Concept Name
concept.Example: To request a list of all available concepts: http://localhost:8080/madhyama/worldbank/sources/2/concepts/data

specificConcept.Name: Specific Concept Details
specificConcept.Description: This call will return the following information, when available, about concepts of a specific source. Source ID, Concept ID and Concept Name
specificConcept.Example: To retrieve a specific concept detail for a source (in this example, Concept ID is “Country” and Source is “WDI Database Archives” or source 57): http://localhost:8080/madhyama/worldbank/sources/57/concepts/Country/data

conceptMetadata.Name: Concept Metadata
conceptMetadata.Description: This call will return the metadata information, when available, about concepts of a specific source. Source ID, Source Name, Concept ID and Concept Name

specificConceptMetadata.Name: Specific Concept Metadata
specificConceptMetadata.Description: To retrieve a specific concept metadata detail for a source.

conceptVariables.Name: Concept Variable Queries
conceptVariables.Description: This call will return the following information, when available, about concept variables of a specific source. Source ID, Concept ID, Concept Name, Variable ID, Variable Name.
conceptVariables.Example: To request a list of all available concepts: http://localhost:8080/madhyama/worldbank/source/2/country/data

specificConceptVariables.Name: Specific Concept Variable Details
specificConceptVariables.Description: This call will return the following information, when available, about concept variables of a specific source. Source ID, Concept ID, Concept Name, Variable ID, Variable Name.
specificConceptVariables.Example: To retrieve a specific concept variable detail for a source (in this example, concept ID is “Country”, Country variable id is “ALB” and Source is World Development Indicators or source 2): http://localhost:8080/madhyama/worldbank/sources/57/Country/ALB/data

dataForCombinationOfSourceAndConcept.Name: Data for combination of Sources and Concepts
dataForCombinationOfSourceAndConcept.Description: Data can be retrieved for any combination of Sources and Concepts.
dataForCombinationOfSourceAndConcept.Example: The following request provides data for Country ALB (Albania), Series AG.AGR.TRAC.NO ( Agricultural machinery, tractors), Time 1975, Version 1997 Apr. In this example, “sources”, “country”, “series”, “time”, and “version” are all keywords: http://localhost:8080/madhyama/worldbank/sources/57/country/ALB/series/AG.AGR.TRAC.NO/time/yr1975/version/199704

dataForMultipleConcepts.Name: Data one or more concepts
dataForMultipleConcepts.Description: To retrieve all the data for one or more Concepts.
dataForMultipleConcepts.Example: To retrieve all the data for one or more Concepts (in this case, the Concept is “time” and the value is “all”): http://localhost:8080/madhyama/worldbank/sources/57/country/ALB/series/AG.AGR.TRAC.NO/time/all/version/199704/data

metadata.Name: Metadata using keywords
metadata.Description: Metadata is data about data. It provides users with more information about the data such as where the data comes from, the way in which the data is measured, and the frequency with which the data is collected, just to name a few. For example, for the indicator Population (total), SP.POP.TOTL, the metadata includes this indicator’s long definition, its sources, its periodicity, its methodology, etc. Retrieves Metadata by using different combinations.

specificMetatype.Name: Specific Metadata Queries
specificMetatype.Description: Metatype simply describes the type of metadata. Region, Income Group, Periodicity, and Source are all examples of Metatypes. Metatype calls retrieve lists of data types available for the given source. Metatype calls will return the following information in the response, when available. Source ID, Concept ID, Metatype ID, Metatype Detail (name and description). To retrieves metatypes for a specific concept.

metadataUsingCombinations.Name: Metadata using combinations
metadataUsingCombinations.Description: Metadata can be retrieved for any combination of Source, Concept and Metatype.

search.Name: Search using keywords
search.Description: The Metadata API can be used to search metadata. Search calls will return the following information, when available: Source ID, Concept ID, Variable ID, Metatype ID and detail. Retrieves Metadata by using keywords in the query string.
